title: Abalone
description: Dataset for predicting the age of abalone from physical measurements. The age of abalone is determined by cutting the shell through the cone, staining it, and counting the number of rings through a microscope -- a boring and time-consuming task. Other measurements, which are easier to obtain, are used to predict the age.

target.name: Rings
target.description: Numbe of rings; +1.5 gives the age in years

features.name: Sex
features.description: Sex / nominal / -- / M, F, and I (infant)

features.name: Length
features.description: Length / continuous / mm / Longest shell measurement

features.name: Diameter
features.description: Diameter	/ continuous / mm / perpendicular to length

features.name: Height
features.description: Height / continuous / mm / with meat in shell

features.name: Whole weight
features.description: Whole weight / continuous / grams / whole abalone

features.name: Shucked weight
features.description: Shucked weight / continuous	 / grams / weight of meat

features.name: Viscera weight
features.description: Viscera weight / continuous / grams / gut weight (after bleeding)

features.name: Shell weight
features.description: Shell weight / continuous / grams / after being dried
